TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit VideoSet extends Microsoft.Office.DocumentManagement.DocumentSets.DocumentSet

Docs.summary: Represents a folder that contains all of the information related to a video.

remarks.para: Information related to a video can include, for example, different renditions and thumbnail images.

Attribute.AttributeName: Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientCallableExceptionConstraint(Condition="Cannot create video set because another file or folder with this name already exists.", ErrorType=typeof(System.InvalidOperationException), FixedId="InvalidOperationException")

Docs.param: The folder in which to create the new VideoSet object.
The name of the new VideoSet object.
The ID of the content type to be used for the new VideoSet object to be created. The ID must be for a content type that inherits from the base Video content type.
Docs.returns: The URL to the new VideoSet object.

remarks.para: This method creates an empty video set container object. It is used for embed code and for external link.

Docs.exception: The parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
A folder with the name already exists.

Docs.param: Absolute or Relative URL for the video item or player page.
Optional properties to be used in configuring the embed code.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the embed code for the video at the specified path.
Docs.returns: String containing IFrame embed code for the video at the specified path.

Attribute.AttributeName: Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientCallableExceptionConstraint(Condition="Video file parent hierarchy cannot be established.", ErrorType=typeof(System.ArgumentNullException), FixedId="ArgumentNullException")

Docs.param: Standalone video file with a known file extension to be migrated.
Docs.summary: For a document library containing the video content type, this method attempts to migrate specified standalone video files into the representation required by video content type.
Docs.returns: The list item corresponding to the migrated video or to the original specified file if migration could not complete for reasons specified in remarks.

remarks.para: For migration to be attempted, the specified file must be in a document library that contains the video content type. It must also be on the list of file extensions specified by web.config SharePoint/MediaAssets node attribute mediaFileExtensions and not appear on the html5AudioFileExtensions attribute value. Otherwise, the specified file will not be modified.

Docs.exception: Video file parent hierarchy cannot be established.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string UploadVideo (Microsoft.SharePoint.SPList list, string fileName, System.IO.Stream file, bool overwriteIfExists, string parentFolderPath);

static member UploadVideo : Microsoft.SharePoint.SPList * string * System.IO.Stream * bool * string -> string

Attribute.AttributeName: Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientCallableExceptionConstraint(Condition="Cannot upload video because another file or folder with this name already exists.", ErrorType=typeof(System.InvalidOperationException), FixedId="InvalidOperationException")

Docs.param: List to upload the file to.
Name of the file, including the extension.
Overwrites the existing file, if true. If false, the existing file will not be updated.
Optional server-relative folder URL for the folder within the list to upload the file to. If null, file will be uploaded to the root folder.
Docs.summary: Uploads the video file with the specified file name to the specified list.
Docs.returns: Absolute URL of the uploaded video file.

remarks.para: In order to get the full video experience, the video file should be uploaded to the document library that contains the video content type.

Docs.exception: Video cannot be found at the specified path.
